info.title: MultiversX Gateway API
info.description:
![MultiversX](/mvx-icon.png)

The documentation describes the endpoints that are available on the mx-chain-proxy-go project. 

Github URL: `https://github.com/multiversx/mx-chain-proxy-go`

This is used on `gateway.multiversx.com` while the public api (`api.multiversx.com`) is a wrapper over it.

This API is organized around REST principles, so if you've interacted with RESTful APIs before, many of the concepts will look familiar.

## Request / Response Format

JSON will be returned for all responses, including errors. Empty or blank fields are omitted. Requests with a message body use JSON as well. Successful requests will return a `2xx` HTTP status.

The general structure of a response is:
``` JSON
{
  data  anything
  error string
  code  string
}
```
Where:
- data: the expected result if the request was successful. `null` otherwise
- error: if the request failed, the reason will be returned in this field. empty otherwise
- code: the internal code for the request. can be `successful`, `internal_issue` or `bad_request`

get.summary: returns the proxy's version and the commit hash
returns the app versions of the nodes behind the proxy
returns data about an address
returns the balance of the provided address in a string format
returns the nonce of the provided address
returns the username of the provided address
returns the code hash behind the provided address
returns the key-value pairs of an {address}
returns the shard ID of the provided address based on the current configuration
returns the value of the provided key for an address
returns all ESDT tokens that the provided address interacted with
returns the tokens identifiers and roles for a given address
returns the token identifiers for a given {address} and the provided role.
returns all ESDT tokens that the provided address interacted with

parameters.name: tokenIdentifier
parameters.description: the token identifier to search for

get.summary: returns the token identifiers of the NFTs registered by the given address.
returns the NFT token data for a given address, token identifier and nonce.

parameters.name: tokenIdentifier
parameters.description: the token identifier to search for

get.summary: returns guardian data for the provided address.
returns all blocks from all shards for a specific round
return a block by nonce and shard.

parameters.name: shard
parameters.description: the shard ID to look after

get.summary: returns a block by nonce, with transactions included.

parameters.name: shard
parameters.description: the shard ID to query the block for

get.summary: returns a block by hash.

parameters.name: shard
parameters.description: the shard ID to query the block for

get.summary: returns a block by hash, with transactions included.

parameters.name: shard
parameters.description: the shard ID to query the block for

get.summary: get the hyperblock at the specified nonce
get the hyperblock with the specific hash
returns the configuration of the network from any observer
returns the status metrics from an observer in the given shard

parameters.name: shard
parameters.description: the shard ID to fetch the status from

get.summary: returns the economics data metric from the last epoch
returns the names of all the issued ESDTs
returns the names of all the issued FungibleESDTs
returns the names of all the issued SemiFungibleESDTs
returns the names of all the issued NonFungibleESDTs
returns general supply information for a specific token
returns the list of direct staked values
returns the list of delegated values
returns the activation epochs metric
returns the current node rating parameters
returns the list of the nodes that were active at the genesis
returns the gas costs configuration available in the network
returns metrics for the trie statistics in the given shard

parameters.name: shard
parameters.description: the shard ID to fetch the status from

get.summary: returns endpoints' metrics
returns the same metrics as /status/metrics but in Prometheus format

post.summary: will reload the observers configuration based on the updated config.toml file. REQUIRES AUTHENTICATION
will reload the full history nodes configuration based on the updated config.toml file. REQUIRES AUTHENTICATION

get.summary: returns the heartbeat data from an observer from any shard. Has a cache to avoid many requests
will return a boolean value indicating if the token's metadata is still stored in accounts' trie, as opposed to the system account
will return the number of epochs left for the public key until it becomes eligible

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: the public key to look after

get.summary: generates the Merkle proof for the given address at a specific root hash

parameters.name: roothash
parameters.description: the root hash to be used when generating the proof

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: the address to be used when generating the proof

get.summary: generates the Merkle proof for the given address at the latest root hash
generates the Merkle proof for a given key of given address at the latest root hash

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: the key to generate the proof for

get.summary: returns the block at the given nonce following the protocol structure

parameters.name: shard
parameters.description: the shard ID to look after

get.summary: returns the block with the given hash following the protocol structure

parameters.name: shard
parameters.description: the shard ID to look after

get.summary: returns the block at the given nonce following the protocol structure, JSON encoded

parameters.name: shard
parameters.description: the shard ID to look after

get.summary: returns the block with the given hash following the protocol structure, JSON encoded

parameters.name: shard
parameters.description: the shard ID to look after

get.summary: returns the miniblock with the given hash following the protocol structure

parameters.name: shard
parameters.description: the shard ID to look after

get.summary: returns the miniblock with the given hash following the protocol structure, JSON encoded

parameters.name: shard
parameters.description: the shard ID to look after

get.summary: returns the epoch start block for a given epoch, following the protocol structure
returns the epoch start block for a given epoch, following the protocol structure, JSON encoded

post.summary: sends a transaction to the network
same as /transaction/send but does not execute it, also the signature of the transaction will not be verified. will output simulation results.

get.summary: returns the transaction which corresponds to the hash

parameters.name: txHash
parameters.description: the transaction hash to search for

get.description: when requesting the entire pool from all shards or only one specific shard, this operation may return "operation not allowed", in case it is disabled from proxy's configuration
get.summary: returns the transactions pool for all shards.
returns the transaction and results which correspond to the hash

parameters.name: txHash
parameters.description: the transaction hash to search for

get.summary: returns the transaction which corresponds to the hash (faster because will ask for transaction from the observer which is in the shard in which the address is part).

parameters.name: txHash
parameters.description: the transaction hash to search for

get.summary: returns the transaction which corresponds to the hash (faster because will ask for transaction from the observer which is in the shard in which the address is part).

parameters.name: txHash
parameters.description: the transaction hash to search for

get.summary: returns the status of the transaction which corresponds to the hash (faster because will ask for transaction status from the observer which is in the shard in which the address is part).

parameters.name: txHash
parameters.description: the transaction hash to search for

get.summary: returns the status of the transaction which corresponds to the hash

parameters.name: txHash
parameters.description: the transaction hash to search for

get.summary: returns the processing status of the transaction which corresponds to the hash. It searches for SCRs generated by the transaction and computes the actual processing status

parameters.name: txHash
parameters.description: the transaction hash to search for

post.summary: sends a bulk of transactions to the network

receives a request containing `receiver`, `numOfTxs` and `value` and will select a random account from the PEM file in the same shard as the address received. Will return the transaction's hash if successful or the interceptor error otherwise

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: the request containing the required fields

get.summary: returns the validator statistics data from an observer from any shard. Has a cache to avoid many requests

post.summary: send a request to the virtual machines and retrives the result in an integer format
send a request to the virtual machines and retrives the result in a hex format
send a request to the virtual machines and retrives the result in a string format
send a request to the virtual machines and retrives the result including altered or deleted account during the request

Transaction.description: Transaction that needs to be created

Fields.name: fields
Fields.description: the requested transaction fields, comma sepparated. If none provided, only hash is returned. Possible values are: hash, nonce, sender, receiver, gaslimit, gasprice, receiverusername, data, value

Shard-id.name: shard-id
Shard-id.description: the shard id to return transactions pool

By-sender.name: by-sender
By-sender.description: the bech32 address of transactions' sender

Last-nonce.name: last-nonce
Last-nonce.description: returns the last nonce from pool. This parameter requires by-sender and does not work with fields

Nonce-gaps.name: nonce-gaps
Nonce-gaps.description: returns the nonce gaps from pool. This parameter requires by-sender and does not work with fields
